column4: Hi, I am trying to boot, and hopefully install if I like it, ubuntu from a USB stick using unetbootin on a windows computer. When I reboot and go to the boot menu, F12 because I am on a dell, I select the usb drive and it says "drive without operating system". Please could I have any help or suggestions?
Any help guys?

Hi, I am trying to boot, and hopefully install if I like it, ubuntu from a USB stick using unetbootin on a windows computer. When I reboot and go to the boot menu, F12 because I am on a dell, I select the usb drive and it says "drive without operating system". Please could I have any help or suggestions?
MD5 test?
thanks, i will read that now
i downloaded it from the ubuntu site
what would be wrong with it?
just md5sum the file
cross reference it with the current md5 for the file on the ubuntu site
sometimes a file can be corrupt for whatever reason, your best to double-check
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuHashes
here is a guide https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BurningIsoHowto
right...
each iso has a hash -  ubuntu-10.04-desktop-i386.iso -- is -- d044a2a0c8103fc3e5b7e18b0f7de1c8
if you locate the iso you downloaded - let's say the name is ubuntu-10.04-desktop-i386.is
in terminal do "md5sum ubuntu-10.04-desktop-i386.iso" and it should spurt out "d044a2a0c8103fc3e5b7e18b0f7de1c8"
note that you have to either be in the folder where the file is or use the actual location as well in the filename
eg; "md5sum ~/Desktop/ubuntu-10.04-desktop-i386.iso"
just read the manual - "man md5sum" in a terminal
because sometimes file integrity can be compromised.. if it were an mp3 it wouldn't really be an issue, but this is an OS we're talking about.. check it to be sure your installing a 100% ok OS
if this is too hard to grasp, I wish you the best of luck with linux ;)
no worries
